intro: Sebastiania glandulosa var. psilophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often in moist, well-drained soils. The leaves are usually glandular-dotted, a feature that distinguishes it from other varieties within the genus.
